original_body_lines: The International Institute of Health Sciences (IIHS) has officially launched the Young Entrepreneurs Hub. This dynamic platform is designed to empower young change-makers by fostering an environment where innovative ideas can thrive, and meaningful partnerships can be nurtured. With social entrepreneurship, community development, and environmental sustainability at its core, the hub seeks to create a new generation of visionary leaders equipped to tackle the challenges of tomorrow.

The launch event featured a diverse lineup of influential speakers who shared their insights on entrepreneurship and the importance of collaboration. Among them were Dr. Kithsiri Edirisinghe (CEO, Co-founder and Director Academic Strategy and International Affairs at IIHS), Maxime Wickramasinghe (Director of Marketing & Business Development at Thema Collection), Pramodh John (Founder and CEO of Demetrix Infotech Private Limited), Ashan Perera (CEO and Founder of Ceylon Kernell’s Pvt Ltd), and Carl Jones (International Development Director at IIHS).

Dr. Kithsiri Edirisinghe, CEO of IIHS, remarked, “The launch of the Young Entrepreneurs Hub marks a significant milestone in our journey towards fostering the next generation of leaders in Sri Lanka.”
